metadata.title: Cooking ( Rajasthani Dal Bati ) Food On Ash - Primitive Technology By Indian Village Women
metadata.description: A showcase of traditional Rajasthani Dal Bati preparation, cooked using primitive technology over hot ash by local village women.

ingredients_detected: wheat flour (gehu ka atta) - used to make the bati dough
water (paani) - used for kneading the dough
clarified butter (ghee) - used for frying the batis and tempering the dal
lentils (dal) - prepared as the main accompaniment
spices (masala) - used in the dal preparation
green chilies (hari mirch) - served as a side
transcription_hindi: [00:00:15.000] पारंपरिक रसोई का सेटअप और आसपास का नज़ारा।
[00:00:23.000] बाटी के लिए आटे की लोइयाँ बनाना और उन्हें गोल आकार देना।
[00:00:35.000] बाटी को तवे पर और सीधी लकड़ी की आग पर पकाना।
[00:01:00.000] धीमी और समान आंच पर पकाने के लिए बाटियों को गर्म राख में दबाना।
[00:01:54.000] पकी हुई बाटियों को राख से निकालकर घी में तलना।
[00:02:30.000] प्याज, नींबू और मिर्च के साथ पूरी राजस्थानी दाल बाटी की थाली परोसना।
transcription_english: [00:00:01.000] Preparation of the dough for the Bati begins by mixing flour and water.
[00:00:15.000] A look at the traditional village kitchen setup and the surrounding environment.
[00:00:23.000] The kneaded dough is divided into small portions and shaped into round Batis.
[00:00:35.000] The Batis are placed on a griddle and roasted over an open wood fire.
[00:00:54.000] The roasted Batis are gathered after being lightly cooked on the griddle.
[00:01:00.000] The Batis are buried deep in hot ash and embers to ensure they cook thoroughly.
[00:01:46.000] The process of preparing the tempering or tadka for the Dal begins.
[00:01:54.000] The fully cooked Batis are retrieved from the ash and fried in pure ghee.
[00:02:30.000] The complete Rajasthani Dal Bati meal is served with sides of onion, lemon, and green chili.
